 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סוּמְפֹּנְיָה‎</span> **noun feminine**, ==bag-pipe, or double pipe, or Pan's pipe== (see [[BDB#GFM|GFM]]<sup>JBL, 1905, 166 ff.</sup>) (Late Hebrew [[BDB#Levy|Levy]]<sup>NHWB iii. 492</sup>; Late Hebrew Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סִימְלאספּוֺן‎</span> is ***tube***, especially ***vein, artery*** Id<sup>ib. 513</sup>; loan-word from (late) Greek <span class="bdbLangGreek">συμφωνία</span>, [[BDB#Krauss|Krauss]]<sup>ii. 376, 390</sup> [[BDB#Bev|Bev]]<sup>41</sup> [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>[[Dan.3.5|Dan 3:5]]</sup> [[BDB#Nes|Nes]]<sup>MM 37</sup> (hence also later Latin <abbr title="transliteration"><u>symphonia</u></abbr>, Ital. ***zampogna***), Prince<sup>KB 9230</sup>); — absolute <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ס‎</span> [[Dan.3.5|Dan 3:5]]; [[Dan.3.15|Dan 3:15]], = <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סיפניה‎</span> [[BDB#Kt|Kt]], <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סוּפֹּנְיָה‎</span> [[BDB#Qr|Qr]] v[[Dan.3.10|Dan 3:10]] (Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***id.***; compare Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ספון‎</span> = <span class="bdbLangGreek">σύμφωνος</span>, in agreement, [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>330</sup> [[BDB#Cooke|GACooke]]<sup>Inscr. 338</sup>).
